result.execSummary:
The defendant Lisa M. Laverty was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Lisa M. Laverty is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Lisa M. Laverty was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Conditions:  

Submit to AODA and follow through with all recommendations. 

Do not possess or consume alcohol.  

No entry into bars/taverns or any establishment that has a primary purpose of selling alcohol.  

Attend, pay for, and successfully complete anger management class.  

The Court did not impose costs in this case as there was one set imposed in concurrent case 16CM2.  Costs in other cases were remitted.

Credit in the event of revocation:  1 day.
Concurrent with: 16CM26 and 16CM2

With huber.  Consecutive to 16CM26.
Consecutive to: 16CM26

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Lisa M. Laverty
Current: 1201 N Main St, Richland Center, WI 53581 United States  (Effective: 05-01-2017)
Prior: 483 North Main, Apt. 107, c/o Leroy Johnson, Richland Center, WI 53581 United States

Defendant Lisa M. Laverty in court, in custody, with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing after revocation in 16CM2, 16CM26 and 16CM31.  ADA Forehand asks the Court for consecutive sentences.  Atty. McDougal asks for concurrent sentences.  Court orders:

30 days in 16CM2 with 2 days credit.
75 days in 16CM26 with 34 days credit.
30 days in 16CM31 with 1 day credit.

Huber granted.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on March 6, 2017 at 10:00 am.
From def to COC on notice of revocation hearing

ADDRESS INFO for Lisa M. Laverty
Current: 483 North Main, Apt. 107, c/o Leroy Johnson, Richland Center, WI 53581 United States  (Effective: 05-24-2016)
Prior: 136 West 6th st, Richland Center, WI 53581 United States

Defendant Lisa M. Laverty in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Several cases called together for status:  16CM2, 16CM26, 16CM31, and 16CM54.  Counsel inform the Court that the parties have reached an agreement which calls for dismissal of 16CM54 in exchange for def's pleas to count 1/dc in 16CM2, amended count 1 in 16CM26, and count 1/bail jumping in 16CM31.  ADA Forehand moves for amendment of count 1/battery to that of dc in 16CM26.  Court allows the amendment.  To the charge as amended, and also to counts 1 in 16CM31 and count 1 in 16CM2, def pleads guilty.  Court's colloquy on pleas.  Finding of guilty.  Sentence withheld for 2 years probation.  Conditions:  AODA and follow through with recommendations; no possession/consumption of alcohol; no entry into bars/taverns or any establishment with primary purpose of selling alcohol; attend, pay for, and successfully complete anger management class.  One set of costs.

Credit in the event of revocation:  2 days in 16CM2.  1 day in 16CM26.  1 day in 16CM31.  

16CM54 dismissed as are all other counts not pled to.

BOND AMENDED 2-24-16 to indicate that "Defendant to report to Richland County Jail to submit to PBT between 10 a.m. and 3 p.m. every day."  Other conditions of the 1-21-16 bond remain as originally set.

Defendant Lisa M. Laverty in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Initial in 16CM26 and 16CM31; status in 16CM2.  Initial appearances completed in both 16CM26 and 16CM31 - charges read; NG pleas entered; status requested and set.

Atty. M addresses Court re bail conditions - def asks for PBT time to be changed due to def's work schedule - asks that it be between 10 and 3.  Court orders bond in 16CM31 amended to change the check-in times to a range of "between 10 a.m. to 3 p.m."  Status conference scheduled for April 13, 2016 at 09:00 am.
